intro: Aneulophus, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Celastraceae. It consists of shrubs and small trees that are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their opposite, simple leaves and small, often clustered flowers. They produce bright red or orange berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Aneulophus species are typically evergreen and have a compact growth habit.
